title: do you know where i can get this proggy ?
content:
on my dead keen o matic i had a program called qm.exe
i'm looking for this program for my new keen o matic

it's a gui very simple yet very usefull
it had good mouse support and buildin screensaver showing the time moving over the screen

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v177/memsys/qm.png[/img]
it looked some thing like this[url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/bg/type/2/memsys.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: do you know where i can get this proggy ?
content:
It looks nice! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] But couldn't find it! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: do you know where i can get this proggy ?
content:
If QM = Quick Menu, then you can get it at [url=http://www.neosoftware.com/qm.html.]www.neosoftware.com/qm.html.[/url] I'm not sure what they limitations are in the shareware version.

You might also consider Power Menu [[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/DOS/powermenu.png[/img]]. I seem to have the only copy on the Internet, which can be downloaded at the [url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/spleen/download.html]Spleen Keen Downloads section[/url].

It's pure keyboard controlled, and won't function as a core desktop, but it works well if all you want to do is turn the computer on, pick a game and start playing.

I haven't erased the database on this copy, so it comes with the same menu structure my 386 first came with. Sheer nostalgia for me.

title: Re: do you know where i can get this proggy ?
